alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 26 at 2:48PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades, including Crater Lake National Park, Highway 62 north of Union Creek, and Highway 138 at Diamond Lake. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour Monday night through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
